measure: events with between 150 and 999 people are subjects to authorization
establishment of a telephone hotline by the cantonal medical association
private clinics and general practitioners are allowed to carry out coronavirus-tests
schools closed
the meeting of the grand council of 28.04.2020 does not take place
the parlamentary fraction (grand council) of 12.05.2020 is cancelled
no parlamentary (grand council) commission meeting take place
construction sites are still allowed, but employers are mandated to enforce sanitary measures
all acute hospitals with a performace mandate are obliged to recieve CoViD-19 patients
4 hospitals are designated to recieve critical CoViD-19 patients
hospitals with existing ICUs must increase their capacity to the maximum
hospitals with intermediate care beds must increase their capacity to the maximum
all acute hospitals must postpone all non essential operation and diminish the number of operation rooms in order to free respirators for ICUs
regional hospital relieve acute hospitals by treating light CoViD-19 cases
in private household we recomend to through PPE, paper towels and hygene items right away in rubbish bags
in households with people infected with CoViD-19 or in quarantine all the garbage should be disposed via rubbish bag
Only go to collection points if absolutely necessary. Non-perishable and clean waste for separate collection should be stored at home if possible.
recycling centers should still remain open, but sanitary measures have to be enforced strictly
school closed
ban on event with more than 100 persons
construction work can stay open
